images.caption: Simplestem Bur-Reed – perennial herb growing on moist to wet places
Simplestem Bur-Reed – flowers are arranged in compound inflorescences – dense globular capitula; these capitula are further arranged in a panicle
Simplestem Bur-Reed – flowers are arranged in compound inflorescences – dense globular capitula; these capitula are further arranged in a panicle
Simplestem Bur-Reed – upper capitula on the tops of branches of the panicle are composed solely of male flowers
Simplestem Bur-Reed – lower capitula are composed solely of female flowers
Simplestem Bur-Reed - fruits are dry, indehiscent, creating typical prickly balls on the plant
Simplestem Bur-Reed – it may create extensive growths on suitable places
Simplestem Bur-Reed – colorized drawing by Josef Dohnal
